translated: The garland of praise of the glorious Vajradaka, the crest jewel of the assembly of logicians, is completed.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po ma ni ka shr'i dzny'a na'i zhal snga nas chag lo ts'a ba sh'akya'i dge slong dpal gyi mtha' can gyis bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa /
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po ma ni ka shr'i dzny'a na'i zhal snga nas chag lo ts'a ba sh'akya'i dge slong dpal gyi mtha' can gyis bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa /
translated: The Indian abbot Manika≈õrƒ´j√±ƒÅna and the Tibetan translator, the monk Shakya Pal, translated, edited, and finalized this text.

original: 'di'i gzhung tshad ni bla ma'i phyag dpe la tshig rkang pa bzhi'i re re zhing yi ge sum cu rtsa drug du gnas shing rkang pa bzhi ka bsdoms pas yi ge stong sum brgya bzhi bcu rtsa bzhi bzhugs so //
analyzed: 'di'i gzhung tshad ni bla ma'i phyag dpe la tshig rkang pa bzhi'i re re zhing yi ge sum cu rtsa drug du gnas shing rkang pa bzhi ka bsdoms pas yi ge stong sum brgya bzhi bcu rtsa bzhi bzhugs so //
translated: The length of this text, according to the master's manuscript, is that each line has thirty-six syllables, and when the four lines are combined, there are one thousand three hundred and forty-four syllables.

original: bod kyi dpe la ni tshig rkang re re la tsheg par nyis brgya dgu bcu rtsa lnga yod cing /
analyzed: bod kyi dpe la ni tshig rkang re re la tsheg par nyis brgya dgu bcu rtsa lnga yod cing /
translated: In the Tibetan text, each line has two hundred and ninety-five syllables.

original: bsdoms pas tsheg par stong brgya brgyad cu yod do//
analyzed: bsdoms pas tsheg par stong brgya brgyad cu yod do//
translated: When combined, there are one thousand eight hundred syllables.
